title: The King's Singers 10th Anniversary Concert Record 1
description:
This is album 1 of The King's Singers 10th Anniversary Concert performed on May 1, 1978.  While this is an 

anniversary concert, it is still typical of a concert by the group.

I have edited this into two different groups.  The first part is edited by song omitting the applause.  This 

was done if you wish to put it on a mp3 player.  I edited out the applause due to the fact I hate it! In the 

Unedited folder you will find the album "as is" without any editing except for the deletion of silence before 

and after a track.

Tracks (Roman numerals indicate the Unedited version)
I.  Songs of the Renaissance
	1. La Guerre (The War by Jannequin)
	2. This Sweet and Merry Month of May (William Byrd)
	3. Come Sirrah Jack Ho! (Thomas Weelkes)
	4. Fair Phyllis I Saw Sitting All Alone (John Farmer)
	5. Contrappunto Bestiale Alla Mente (The Animals Sing Counterpoint by Adriano Banchieri)
	6. Valle, Che De Lamenti Miei (That my Valle Laments by Giaches de Wert)

II. Quatre Petites Prieres de Saint Francois D'Assise (Four Small Prayers of St. Francis of Assisi by Poulenc)
	(Note the group sings these as one)
	7. Salut, Dame Sainte
	   Tout puissant Dieu
	   Seigneur, je vous en prie
	   O mes tres chers freres

III. Lalela Zulu (Music by Stanley Glasser Words by Lewis Nkosi)
	8. Lalela Zulu (Chant)
	9. Mambabo! (Wow!)
	10. Lala Mntwana (Sleep, child)
	11. Uhambo Ngesitimela (Train Journey)
	12. Egoli (Johannesburg)
	13. Umdanso WaseGoli (Jo'burg Dance) 

This album is no longer in production though you may find it on eBay.  Most of these songs are available on 

other newer albums.

The King's Singers
	Nigel Perrin & Alastair Hume - Counter Tenors
	Alastair Thompson* (Tenor)
	Anthony Holt & Simon Carrington (Baritones)
	Brian Kay (Bass)
*This was Alastair Thompson's last performance with the group as he left to pursue other things.  He was 

replaced by Bill (Grayston) Ives.

---> I am looking for Record 2 of this concert (preferably for free down load)
